name: Annie Biby Rapheal

experience.title: Summer Intern R&D
experience.description: Project: Network Dimensioning using Bayesian Machine Learning Model• Conducted exploratory data analysis, modeling, and operationalization of a trained predictor for resourceconsumption for one of the network elements.• Operationalized the ML training pipeline using Dataiku’s Data Science Studio (DSS) for integration to webapplication.

experience.title: Research Assistant at Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering, IIT Kharagpur
experience.description: Project: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Motion Generation of a Hexapod Robot• Conducted literature review on the state-of-the-art deep reinforcement learning methods for motiongeneration of a multi-legged robot and to gain knowledge on deep reinforcement learning.Project: Modelling the Clay Content using DRS Spectral Data• Developed models for clay content prediction using PLS regression, BPNN and Ensemble Learning Model.• Pre-processed the spectral data using Savitzky-Golay derivatives, Log(1/Ri), multiplicative scatter correction(MSC) and standard normal variate (SNV).• Designed the models combining PLS regression with pre-processing techniques, combining variable selectionalgorithms with BPNN and ensemble learning model by using PLS regression models as base learners.• Analysed the error in prediction models using RMSE, RPD and R2.
experience.description_html: Project: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Motion Generation of a Hexapod Robot• Conducted literature review on the state-of-the-art deep reinforcement learning methods for motiongeneration of a multi-legged robot and to gain knowledge on deep reinforcement learning.Project: Modelling the Clay Content using DRS Spectral Data• Developed models for clay content prediction using PLS regression, BPNN and Ensemble Learning Model.• Pre-processed the spectral data using Savitzky-Golay derivatives, Log(1/Ri), multiplicative scatter correction(MSC) and standard normal variate (SNV).• Designed the models combining PLS regression with pre-processing techniques, combining variable selectionalgorithms with BPNN and ensemble learning model by using PLS regression models as base learners.• Analysed the error in prediction models using RMSE, RPD and R2.

experience.title: Deep Learning Intern
experience.description: Project: Arrow, Bracket and Callout detection Model and Description generation of Balance Sheets • Worked in developing an Arrow, Bracket and Callout detection model (ABC Model) for Accounting Tables, using SSD (single Shot Detection) architecture. • Generated artificial data for ABC model using OpenCV • Developed a module to calculate the performance metrics of the model • Worked in automating the description generation of Balance sheets.Developed the modules for grouping and mapping of table contents using OCR, LSD and self designed module to group contents based on spacing.
experience.description_html: Project: Arrow, Bracket and Callout detection Model and Description generation of Balance Sheets • Worked in developing an Arrow, Bracket and Callout detection model (ABC Model) for Accounting Tables, using SSD (single Shot Detection) architecture. • Generated artificial data for ABC model using OpenCV • Developed a module to calculate the performance metrics of the model • Worked in automating the description generation of Balance sheets.Developed the modules for grouping and mapping of table contents using OCR, LSD and self designed module to group contents based on spacing.

experience.title: Research Assistant at Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur
experience.description: Project II : Stock Market Forecasting using Evolutionary Prediction Model • Developed a Stock Market Prediction Model using Mamdani Fuzzy rule based system (FRBS) in R. • Developed the rule base with RIPPER by converting a regression problem into classification problem using modified Chi-merge discretization. • Tuned the data base using genetic algorithm. • Designed triangular, trapezoidal and Guassian membership functions for FRBS using intervals from discretization. • Studied the effect of membership function on prediction error by monitoring the MAPE for stock price data sets.Project I : Portfolio Optimization Using Multi Objective Genetic Algorithms • Developed a model in python for Optimization of portfolio using multi objective genetic algorithms. • Designed the objective function using risk and return of the portfolio to obtain the pareto optimal front for risk-return trade off • Developed modules for multi objective genetic algorithms Vector Evaluated Genetic algorithm (VEGA), Fuzzy VEGA, Multi Objective Genetic Algorithm (MOGA) and Non-Dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm (NSGA) by including unity constraint, cardinality constraint, floor constraint and round-a-lot constraint.
experience.description_html: Project II : Stock Market Forecasting using Evolutionary Prediction Model • Developed a Stock Market Prediction Model using Mamdani Fuzzy rule based system (FRBS) in R. • Developed the rule base with RIPPER by converting a regression problem into classification problem using modified Chi-merge discretization. • Tuned the data base using genetic algorithm. • Designed triangular, trapezoidal and Guassian membership functions for FRBS using intervals from discretization. • Studied the effect of membership function on prediction error by monitoring the MAPE for stock price data sets.Project I : Portfolio Optimization Using Multi Objective Genetic Algorithms • Developed a model in python for Optimization of portfolio using multi objective genetic algorithms. • Designed the objective function using risk and return of the portfolio to obtain the pareto optimal front for risk-return trade off • Developed modules for multi objective genetic algorithms Vector Evaluated Genetic algorithm (VEGA), Fuzzy VEGA, Multi Objective Genetic Algorithm (MOGA) and Non-Dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm (NSGA) by including unity constraint, cardinality constraint, floor constraint and round-a-lot constraint.

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: Project: Generating Rank of Celebreties and Representing the Causation using Wordcloud • Worked in developing a product to rank celebrities, based on the data collected from various articles in online news. • Designed an algorithm to alert the aberrations in data collections using central limit theorem. • Developed python code to generate bigrams and trigrams from article contents imported using Solr and ranked them using likelihood ratio. Used wordclouds to visualize the data based on the ranking. • Learned and used basic Git commands to integrate the developed modules to work flow.
experience.description_html: Project: Generating Rank of Celebreties and Representing the Causation using Wordcloud • Worked in developing a product to rank celebrities, based on the data collected from various articles in online news. • Designed an algorithm to alert the aberrations in data collections using central limit theorem. • Developed python code to generate bigrams and trigrams from article contents imported using Solr and ranked them using likelihood ratio. Used wordclouds to visualize the data based on the ranking. • Learned and used basic Git commands to integrate the developed modules to work flow.

recommendations: Marcial Gutiérrez “As part of the Ericsson Summer 2021 Internship Program, Annie came to work with us at the Product Development Unit Converged Core to do some Data Science work around using Machine Learning for predictive network resources consumption, as well as operationalizing these results for an internal web application. Annie’s main contribution was on doing the exploratory data analysis, modeling, and operationalization of a trained predictor of resources consumption for one of our products. Her execution throughout the course of the project was outstanding. On the Data Science part, she comprehensively gathered and discussed her insights on the datasets, models’ performance, and interpretability, always providing relevant comparisons and recommendations in every sprint. On the operationalization part, she was able to learn how to use Dataiku’s Data Science Studio (DSS) in a remarkable speed and prepare the ML training pipeline for her datasets in line with the provided requirements and expectations to integrate this with the web application. Along the way, she also made sure that everything was thoroughly documented. I can attribute Annie’s superb results to how structured she is in the way she approaches a problem. Additionally, she possesses great communication skills, using the appropriate technical language, which is also evidence of her level of competency in the area. On top of this, she was a great team player and a very pleasant person to work with. I would definitely recommend Annie for any type of Data Science role due to her ability to quickly understand the problem at hand and approach it in a structured manner, especially if delivering relevant easy to digest and timely results are of utmost importance.”
